result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell A Krider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs assessed paid from bond posted.
Number of images to be determined by stipulation of parties  and submitted to the court for assessment to be added to judgment. Balance of bond to be held for that determination.
*1/26/15- Stipulation/Order filed as to number of images. $500 assessment placed on Amended JOC and paid in full from bond being held. Remaining bond to be returned to poster. 

Pay supervision fees
  Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling

Participate in assessment/programs/treatment deemed appropriate by agent and pay costs of treatment
Computer and Internet use only as approved by agent
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years with supervised contact with any relative under 18 years
Submit to DNA sample

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maxwell A Krider

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular

Parties further stipulate to a $500.00 surcharge to be paid during the period of probation.  Scanned and forwarded to Controller.

Email to DA's office regarding stipulated amount of images to be assessed. Amended JOC to be done.
October 8, 2014 / Sentencing Hearing / Lisa Balkowski
August 14, 2014 / Plea Hearing / Kathy Jagow

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of PSI with no additions or corrections. Sentencing statement by Atty Reddin. Statement by defendant. Court renders sentence. Balance of bail to be held for stipulated determination by parties as to number of images for cost assessment.
Atty Reddin files psych evaluation and risk assessment for sentencing on 10/8 - scanned & forwarded to B3.
Scanned PSI and forwarded to Br 3
forwarded to scanning. Copies distributed to DA and Defense counsel
Sentencing hearing on October 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Upon a plea to the charge, the State is recommending incarceration with the amount of time to be determined by the Court.  Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilt. Matter to be set over for sentencing. Pre-sentence ordered by the court. Defendant warned that bail conditions are still in place until sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Copy of letter sent by District Attorney's office
Status conference on August 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment.  Jury trial removed from the courts 07-22-2014 jury trial calendar.  State to inform the court and defense in writing as to status of reports by 07-22-2014.  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Jury trial on July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel states both he and the State are awaiting information from the Crime Lab and requests adjournment. Court will set matter for jury trial.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Patti L Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received partial offer from the State but not quite ready to resolve. Matter set for a projected guilty plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial.  State informs. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.

Matter set for competency review hearing. Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties in receipt of doctor's report. State asks that the court adopt the report and its findings. Defense counsel in agreement with doctor's findings. Court finds defendant to be competent to proceed.  Defense files waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Copy of Report forwarded to DA's office and Defense counsel.
Scanned and forwarded to Br. 3.
For Competency Evaluation
Review hearing on April 9, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with Atty William Reddin.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting competency evaluation. Court so orders.  Review hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Maxwell A Krider in court with attorney Wilfred P De Junco both appearing by video conference.  Defendant in custody. Adam Y Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading waived.  Defendant is not sure if he will hire private counsel or have public defenders office represent him.  State requests $10,000 signature bond with conditions that defendant not use Internet except for school, not to possess any pornography.  Court orders $2000.00 cash bond, no use of internet except for school, not to possess any pornography.  Time limits waived for a preliminary hearing.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
